name: Maple Dijon Salmon
author: Laura Beth Gerhard
summary: This is a quick and easy salmon dish that my entire family loves. Leftovers can be made into an interesting salmon salad.
ingredients: kosher salt and ground black pepper to taste
1 tablespoon canola oil, or as needed
directions: Preheat the oven to 450 degrees F (230 degrees C)
Combine maple syrup, Dijon mustard, thyme, and cinnamon in a small bowl
Season salmon with salt and pepper
Heat canola oil in a large oven-proof saute pan over medium heat
Cook salmon until browned, about 3 minutes
Flip and brush surface generously with maple syrup mixture
Cook until bottom is browned, about 3 minutes more
Transfer to the preheated oven and bake until salmon flakes easily with a fork, 5 to 10 minutes more
